com.bigdata.rdf.graph

Interface IStaticFrontier

  • All Superinterfaces:
    Iterable<org.openrdf.model.Value>
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    StaticFrontier2

    public interface IStaticFrontier
extends Iterable<org.openrdf.model.Value>
    Interface abstracts the fixed frontier as known on entry into a new round.
    Author:
    Bryan Thompson

    • Method Detail

      • size

        int size()
        The number of vertices in the frontier. TODO Long? Or just do not allow in scale-out?

      • isEmpty

        boolean isEmpty()
        Return true if the frontier is known to be empty.

      • isCompact

        boolean isCompact()
        Return true iff the frontier is known to be compact (no duplicate vertices).

        Note: If the frontier is not compact, then the IGASEngine may optionally elect to eliminate duplicate work when it schedules the vertices in the frontier.

        Note: A non-compact frontier can arise when the IGASScheduler chooses a per-thread approach and then copies the per-thread segments onto the shared backing array in parallel. This can reduce the time between rounds, which can speed up the overall execution of the algorithm significantly.

      • resetFrontier

        void resetFrontier(int minCapacity,
                 boolean sort,
                 Iterator<org.openrdf.model.Value> vertices)
        Reset the frontier from the supplied vertices.
        Parameters:
        minCapacity - The minimum capacity of the new frontier. (A minimum capacity is specified since many techniques to compact the frontier can only estimate the required capacity.)
        ordered - true iff the vertices are not known to be ordered and SHOULD be ordered (some backends do not benefit from ordering the vertices).
        vertices - The vertices in the new frontier.
